alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 12:38PM EDT until August 28 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Northern City of Chesapeake in southeastern Virginia... The City of Norfolk in southeastern Virginia... The City of Portsmouth in southeastern Virginia... The City of Suffolk in southeastern Virginia... The Northwestern City of Virginia Beach in southeastern Virginia... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 1238 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by showers and thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Downtown Portsmouth, Downtown Norfolk, Old Dominion University, Norfolk State University, Churchland, Deep Creek, Regent University, Ocean View, Virginia Wesleyan University, Great Bridge, Kempsville, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Ghent, Cradock, Western Branch and Norview. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk; City of Virginia Beach
